programme.title: Glass
programme.desc: David Dunn tries to stay one step ahead of the law while delivering vigilante justice on the streets of Philadelphia. His special talents soon put him on a collision course with the Beast -- the psychotic madman who has superhuman strength and 23 distinct personalities. Their epic showdown leads them to an encounter with the mysterious Elijah Price, the criminal mastermind who holds critical secrets for both men.

programme.title: Once Bitten
programme.desc: A centuries-old vampire, the countess (Lauren Hutton) has kept her youthful look by drinking the blood of male virgins. Since she finds this prey challenging to come by, she is thrilled when she meets young Mark Kendall (Jim Carrey), who wants to lose his virginity, yet has a reluctant girlfriend, Robin (Karen Kopins). After luring Mark away from a club, the countess drinks his blood, but the hapless guy isn't sure what has happened until he starts exhibiting unusual symptoms.

programme.title: Téléfoot
programme.desc: Chaque dimanche, retrouvez le meilleur du football et notamment toutes les actualités de la Ligue 1 McDonald's : résumés des matchs, reportages, coulisses, portraits et interviews exclusives. A la présentation du magazine historique, Grégoire Margotton vous donne rendez-vous accompagné du champion du monde Bixente Lizarazu ou de Rio Mavuba, ancien international français et champion de France avec Lille. A leurs côtés, les journalistes Thomas Mekhiche et Sévérine Parlakou complètent l'équipe.

programme.title: Les douze coups de midi
programme.desc: Chaque jour, quatre candidats s'affrontent pour empocher les 30 000 euros de la cagnotte et décrocher l'étoile mystérieuse et ses cadeaux. Seule condition, bien répondre aux questions de culture générale posées par Jean-Luc Reichmann.

programme.title: Petits plats en équilibre
programme.desc: Chaque jour, Laurent Mariotte propose des recettes simples et savoureuses pour profiter des ingrédients de saison, en donnant la part belle aux produits locaux.

programme.title: Reportages découverte
programme.desc: Ils sont pâtissiers, ferronniers d'art, marqueteuses et leurs créations sont uniques, souvent hors de prix. Et désormais, ce sont les plus grandes fortunes internationales qui font appel à eux. Des ateliers en France aux intérieurs fastueux de leurs clients, à Monaco, Miami ou Singapour, des équipes ont suivi trois artisans français qui osent l'aventure de l'export et relèvent les défis les plus fous.

programme.title: Football : Eliminatoires de la Coupe du monde (UEFA) : Islande v France
programme.desc: A Reykjavik, les Bleus de Didier Deschamps pourraient bien valider leur billet pour la Coupe du monde 2026 en cas de succès face à l'Islande. Mais la bande à Kylian Mbappé n'aura pas la partie facile face aux hommes d'Arnar Gunnlaugsson, qui les avaient déjà fait douter lors du match aller disputé début septembre au Parc des Princes. Ce jour-là, les Islandais avaient ouvert le score rapidement et longtemps résisté avant que les Français n'égalent sur penalty grâce à Mbappé, puis finissent par l'emporter grâce à un but de Bradley Barcola. Cette fois, les vice-champions du monde sont prévenus : pour s'imposer, ils devront livrer un gros match.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.desc: With one backstage pass for a Ratbucket gig, Dennis and his friends pass themselves off as Ratbucket, only for the real Ratbucket not to be able to play at his own concert. Followed by 60 second Dennis and 'Bad Dad'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Dennis breaks his bike, Dad is unable to afford a new one, so Dennis convinces him to ask his boss for a raise. Unfortunately, Mr Scrimp reduces his wages instead. Dennis then trashes his house to convince Scrimp that his family are poor, so that Mr Scrimp will feel compelled to raise Dad's wages. Just as Scrimp has been taken in by Dennis' plan, Mum and Dad arrive home laden with shopping bags, resulting in Dad getting fired on the spot. Dennis resolves to get Dad his old job back by secretly causing chaos at his office. To restore order Scrimp rehires Dad, sealing the deal with a generous pay rise. Mum and Dad repair the house, but still don't have enough money to buy Dennis a new bike, instead it gets repaired with Dad's office rubber bands and paperclips. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dennis Hiccups'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Believing Gnasher and Gnipper to be trapped in Beanotown Dog Pound, Dennis comes up with a plan to rescue his friends and bring them both home. Followed by more Dennis and Gnasher episodes.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: When Dennis breaks his skateboard again, Dad agrees to buy Dennis the best skateboard there is as a replacement if he is able to win a prize at the upcoming school award ceremony. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dance of the Seven Pies'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis tries to get a birthday present by saying thank you to his relatives. However, because of Dennis' naughty personality, they take his attempts in a negative way. Followed by 'Dennis Hiccups'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Masters of the House'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After a wrestling accident, Gnasher swallows a canister of laughing gas at the vet's. Dennis, along with Gnasher hide in the conference centre, where dad gives a speech. However, the canister leaks, causing Gnasher to fart laughing gas and having everyone laughing. Followed by 'Attack of the Walterbot'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis and Co. have to control Pie Face's obsession with pies during the Pie Festival. Otherwise, they will be grounded. Followed by 'Great Outdoors'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: On a school trip, Dennis finds out that he is descentant to a warrior tribe. He also discovers that Montanna Smith (a famous Indiana Jones-esque explorer and one of Walter's personal heroes) is actually a thief who's trying to steal the treasure of Dennis' ancestor. Will he be stopped before he gets his hands on the treasure? Followed by Dog Tired.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Mum has bought curtain material for the soon to be newly decorated kitchen, and asks Dad to look after it while she is out. However, Dad falls asleep and mistakenly agrees that Dennis can use it as a giant sail. When Dad realises that it has gone, he calls Dennis to bring it back, but unfortunately Dennis gets into a spot of bother with the colonel, who takes the curtain material off Dennis. In an attempt to steal it back, the garden being wrecked and the kitchen is left looking like a bombsite. Dennis, Gnasher and Dad have to clean up the whole kitchen and redecorate it in time for Mum returning. When Mum decides it is time to hang the new curtains, Dennis is about to get the curtain material, but Mum reveals that she has changed her mind and bought new curtains instead. Followed by 'Fangs for the Memories'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis, his friends and Walter's friends get marooned on a desert island when Dennis attempts to escape a boring field trip. Followed by Substitute Creecher

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis plays a prank on the citizens of Beanotown, causing them to evacuate, which causes trouble for Dennis later. Followed by 'No Place Like Home'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Gnasher and Gnipper enter a dog show, regardless of Walter saying they don't have true talent. He wants Athena and Miss Mini Wuff to win, but Walter has just underestimated Gnasher's true capabilities. Followed by Grounded.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Athena gets Gnasher envy when seeing a pampered version of Gnasher in a magazine and when she hears that Dennis owns an Abyssinian wire-haired tripe hound (Gnasher), she wants him. However, being an owner to Gnasher isn't all cracked up to be! Followed by 'Splash'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis gets a case of the hiccups from Mr. Har Har's can-o-giggles and is looking for a way to cure them ready for a film premier. Followed by Athena's Party

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: The garden is accidentaly wrecked when Dennis tries to give Gnasher a bath, so the gang have to fix the mess before Mum comes home. Followed by 'Run Rabbit Run'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis makes a line of practical jokes for Mr. Scrimp, called 'The Menace Collection.' However, Dennis soon learns that it will put Mr. Har Har out of business.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Walter takes up origami as a martial art, Dennis scoffs and comes up with his own martial art, and so the two prepare to battle it out. Followed by 'Smelling of Roses'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.desc: Dennis and his pet dog, Gnasher, live by just one rule: Kids should make all the rules! Followed by Dance of the Seven Pies.

programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 'Fish Tale'.

programme.desc: For a school project, Dennis and Walter both build robots. However, during an accident, both robots merge, causing Dennis and Walter to defend the school. Followed by 'No Joke.'

programme.title: Gunsight Ridge
programme.desc: Stage line agent investigates a series of robberies by taking the job of a deputy sheriff in a border Arizona town.

programme.title: The Ugly Ones
programme.desc: An escapee Mexican outlaw returns to his hometown, where he is sheltered from a tenacious bounty killer by the townspeople - who discover too late that he is a changed man.

programme.title: Bad Man's River
programme.desc: Robber Roy King loses his wife, Alicia, to revolutionary Montero. Despite their rivalry they collaborate in an attempt to rob the Mexican government of one million dollars.

programme.title: Djurado
programme.desc: Djurado is a gun-slinging professional gambler who struts into the small town of Silver Mine and wins half of the local saloon, the other part of which belongs to Barbara, whilst battling notorious outlaw Tucan.

programme.title: The Gay Amigo
programme.desc: Mistaken for bandits, Cisco and Pancho are captured by the Captain, who releases them to track the real gang. Cisco discovers the true leaders are the editor and blacksmith. Using cunning, he sows distrust between them, gains the blacksmith's trust, and joins the gang, setting up a trap to bring the criminals to justice.

programme.title: Dead are Countless
programme.desc: As a child, Johnny witnessed his father's death at the hands of soldiers. Now an outlaw, he seeks revenge by killing soldiers whenever possible. Lieutenant Garringo is tasked with capturing Johnny and bringing him back alive. A dangerous game of cat and mouse ensues, with Garringo determined to fulfill his mission.

programme.title: The Girl from San Lorenzo
programme.desc: Two outlaws posing as Cisco and Pancho are wreaking havoc. When the real Cisco and Pancho are captured, the criminals plan a final heist, using the duo as alibis. After breaking them out of jail, the real heroes have a chance to escape and clear their names by capturing the imposters. Will they succeed or be caught again?

programme.title: Requiem for a Gringo
programme.desc: A unique Euro-western with the hero as an astrologist who wears a leopard suit.

programme.title: Return of Shanghai Joe
programme.desc: A sinister town boss called Pat Barnes has exploited almost everyone in the town.

programme.title: For a Book of Dollars
programme.desc: A bounty hunter named Amen is hired by a group of nuns to recover stolen money. However, the nuns turn out to be female desperadoes in disguise, plotting to retrieve the booty pillaged by the ruthless outlaw Catapult and his gang. Amen must navigate a world of deception, danger, and betrayal to complete the job.

programme.title: Apache Rose
programme.desc: Old Western Movie from 1947 starring Roy Rogers directed by William Witney: Apache Rose - Roy is an oil prospector. His efforts to get drilling rights on an old Spanish land grant are countered by gamblers from an off-shore gambling boat determined to control the land (and oil) themselves.

programme.title: Cut-Throats Nine
programme.desc: A cavalry troop is escorting a wagonload of convicts on their way to prison through the mountains when they are attacked by a bandit gang. Only a sergeant, his beautiful young daughter, and an assortment of seven sadistic, murderous prisoners survive, and they are left without horses or a wagon. The sergeant must find a way to get his prisoners to their destination while protecting his daughter, watching out for the still-pursuing bandits, and trying to determine which prisoner is the man who raped and murdered his wife.

programme.title: Boot Hill
programme.desc: Victims of oppressive town boss Honey are offered help by an unusual alliance of gunmen and circus performers.

programme.title: The General
programme.desc: When Union spies steal an engineer's beloved locomotive, he pursues it single-handedly and straight through enemy lines.

programme.title: Kill Django... Kill First
programme.desc: In a mining town, Johnny MaGee clashes with banker Anthony Burton, who uses bandits and deceit to seize gold mines and control the economy. Partnering with an old miner, Johnny seeks justice, while navigating love, betrayal, and alliances. As tensions rise, a bounty hunter joins the fray, promising a final showdown against corruption.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A battle of the sexes which has raged in Broughton since the First World War comes to a head when ageing feminist Mildred Danvers is found dead after returning to her childhood home. As Barnaby investigates, the misogynist vicar Rev Gantis is shot through the head during a humiliating donkey race at the village fair. Is the killer on the side of the men or women - or do tragedies in Broughton's past hold the answer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Controversial plans to build a supermarket in Elverton-cum-Latterly lead to murder when a man is stabbed to death and the pollution advisor for the site seems to be spending more time with the women of the village than at work. Can Barnaby and Jones discover the truth and learn what is really polluting Elverton?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Worthy's baritone Connor Simpson is killed just days before a competition, the rest of the choir, including Joyce Barnaby, are in fear for their lives. Barnaby and Jones investigate and find an atmosphere of bitter rivalry and tense marital relationships. Then, there's another murder and the race is on to catch the killer before the choral showdown.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby begins to question the guilt of a Midsomer Malham woman who is on trial for the murder of her best friend. The evidence is stacked against her, but she doesn't appear deluded or obsessed with the dead woman's husband as the prosecution claim. With the help of a frail pensioner - the key witness, can Barnaby and Jones discover what really happened on the night of the murder?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Barnabys plan to renew their wedding vows for their 25th anniversary when Tom is distracted by a murder of a dying man committed with an Indian sword in Badger's Drift.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The naked body of a young woman is found strangled in a local woodland nine years after three identical murders took place there. As DCI Barnaby and DS Troy investigate the killings, they are led further and further into the murky, clandestine world of Midsomer Worthy.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious events and the discovery of his relative's body lead the residents of Aspern Tallow to believe that Jonathan Lowrie's ghost is at large in their community. DCI Barnaby and DS Troy attempt to determine whether these strange occurrences are supernatural or if there is a more rational explanation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the sleepy village of Martyr Warren, two opposing groups of travellers have set up home. DCI Barnaby and DS Troy are called in to investigate when the local magistrate, principal adversary of the new arrivals in the village, is found shot dead at his home.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May drive across a lake an E-Type Jaguar and Aston Martin DB5. Chris Evans and Ian Wright are stars in a reasonably priced car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The guys bring their mothers in to help review a range of small cars Richard takes out a new BMW 3 Series Jeremy tries a Cadillac CTS-V.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy drives a Mercedes SLK and a Porsche Boxster 2 around a deserted village while avoiding shots from snipers Richard tests a Maserati Gran Sport.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy drives from London to Oslo in a Mercedes McLaren SLR Richard and James take the ferry to see who gets there first.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard takes a Ford Transit to Germany to see what it can do on the Nurburgring Jeremy races a marathon runner across London.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Sir Tim Rice the boys go to Iceland Ferrari F430.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Hammond and May go out to earn a living Jeremy drives a BMW M5 hatchbacks.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James exhibits a high level of daring.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team finds out if driving a Lamborghini Murcielago roadster gives the same kick as 12 angry bulls, the world's greatest power sliders grace the track, and there's a look at the Ford F150 SVT Lightning pick-up.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team heads for the Isle of Man to decide which is best: the V8 Vantage Aston Martin, BMW M6 or Porsche 911 Carrera S. The Ascari KZ1 supercar takes to the track and actor Trevor Eve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy races a rock climber Richard and James check out radio controlled cars celebrity guest is Ian Wright.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy, Richard and James drive three supercars through France Ford Focus.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Search for a mid-engined Italian supercar for less than 10,000 British pounds Pagani Zonda F record-breaking yachtswoman Ellen MacArthur.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy races a Bugatti Veyron against a plane from Alba, Italy to the top of London's NatWest Tower Richard tests the new Marcos Nigel Mansell.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy tests to see if he can drive faster in real life or on a computer game the effect of sub-zero temperatures on a car and Richard David Walliams.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Fitting a homemade convertible roof to a Renault Espace people carrier.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: A contest between the Jaguar XK, the BMW650i and the Mercedes SL350 an ice race between a powerful rally car and a jet-powered kayak chef Gordon Ramsay is the "Star in the Reasonably Priced Car."

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team find out if it's possible to build a truly amphibious car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard pits the new Porsche Cayenne Turbo S against the British Army's freefall parachute display team . the "Star in the Reasonably Priced Car" is Ewan McGregor.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies see some children visit a level crossing and watch a train pass by. The Teletubbies play their Ready, Steady, Go game.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Alex Pascall and some children sing to their dolls to rock them to sleep. Laa-Laa wants to sing a lovely song, but Tinky Winky is crunching his Tubby Toast too loudly!

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies march up and down a hill and then they watch some children explore the colour pink. Tinky Winky doesn't know how to make Tubby Custard.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Laa-Laa dances with her ball. A little boy tells us why he likes to live in his block of flats. A balloon appears in Teletubbyland. The Teletubbies follow a balloon.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies line up to say 'Eh-oh' and then watch Matthew and Mark feed a baby calf. The Teletubbies play a game to see who can eat their Tubby Custard the slowest, but Po can't wait and eats her Tubby Custard very fast.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies and some children watch Tamzin Griffin pretend to be Funny Lady and tell the story of the Naughty Pig. Dipsy's hat keeps blowing away and he has to chase it all over Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa run into Home Hill to say 'Eh-oh', but where 's Po? Some children help their dad to wash his car. They get very wet and soapy.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Tubbies crawl through the arch in Home Hill and watch Alex Pascall and some children sing 'Handy Hands'.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children play with balls of different shapes and sizes. In Teletubbyland, something happens to Dipsy's hat.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number two. Dipsy and Laa-Laa are eating Tubby Toast. They play the game 'Two Little Teletubbies', but while they are playing the Noo-Noo tidies up their Tubby Toast.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies take turns to stand on a hill, in front of the house, next to a tree under a cloud. Andy Brown and some children visit some giraffes. The animals march through Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies are eating Tubby Toast. They stop to watch Amy making pasta. A ball of string appears in Teletubbyland. Po knocks the string in to the air with her scooter and it makes a stringy mess all over Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky calls the other Tubbies to come and watch Tamzin Griffin pretend to be Funny Lady and tell the story about the naughty sock. The Tubby Toast machine makes a tower of tubby toast.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies play 'Boo', but stop to watch Ned help his dad plant and water some geraniums. In Teletubbyland, nine pretty flowers and a watering can appear.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies love playing on the slide. They stop to watch Andy Brown and some children digging in the sand for crabs.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Samira and her friends show the Teletubbies their gymnastic routines. The Teletubbies do their own gymnastics.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch Matthew and James help their uncle milk the cows. In Teletubbyland, the Tubby Custard machine isn't working, so they sing a special 'Tubby Custard' song. Then, the Tubby Custard machine works again.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Tubbies watch a little boy peel and mash some eggs for an egg mayonnaise sandwich. The Teletubbies laugh when they make a tune whilst eating their Tubby Custard.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies dance around the trees and watch some children drum with their friend Norris. Tinky Winky dance on the roof of Home Hill and wakes up the other Tubbies.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy says "Eh-oh" and runs off to find the other Tubbies. They watch some children make fantastic animals from papermache.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky says "Eh-oh". The Teletubbies and some children watch Tamzin Griffin pretend to be the Funny Lady and tell the story of the naughty hat. The Teletubbies are very happy when they find their favourite things to play with.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: In Teletubbyland, the Tubbies are trying to be quiet. They watch Oscar read the story of the Gingerbread Boy to his brother Felix. A voice trumpet appears and sings the nursery rhyme.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po fetches the other to watch Andy Brown and two children look for some rabbits. In Teletubbyland, Tinky Winky is looking for Po. He looks for her everywhere, but she is hiding from him. When he finds her all the Tubbies dance a happy dance.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies dance an up and down dance. They watch some children painting pictures and patterns on to eggs. In Teletubbyland, Laa-Laa dances with her ball until the magical tree appears.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch a little boy show us how to make a Turban. The Tubbies go for a walk, but Po, Laa-Laa and Dipsy want to play with their favourite things.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A voice trumpet rises and teaches the Teletubbies a nursery rhyme. Then they watch Becky go for a ride on a Tram. Po rides her scooter too fast and knocks the other Tubbies over.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Tubbies watch some children are playing football in the park. Laa-Laa and Po love playing with the ball. While they play they sing a song about the ball.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies pop up from behind a hill to watch Tamzin Griffin pretend to be Funny Lady and tell the story of the naughty sausage. Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Po go for a walk, so Laa-Laa decides to dance a secret dance.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number three. Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa go for a walk. They count three trees and three flowers and Po follows behind counting too.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies are asleep when a voice trumpet appears singing the rhyme 'Frére Jacques'. The Teletubbies laugh and call "Again, again!"

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies see a little girl and her brother who love salad. They go shopping in a market a market with their grandma to buy some salad to eat.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch two boys make Chinese Lanterns with their uncle. In Teletubbyland, it is time for Tubby Toast, but where has Laa-Laa's toast gone?

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies and some children learn about the colour blue. In Teletubbyland Po is watching the blue sky when it begins to rain.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Noo-Noo tidies up Home hill before the Teletubbies slide up the slide to watch Natalie tell us about her brother's christening.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch Sarah and Mark give their sheep a winter-feed. In Teletubbyland, the Teletubbies cannot decide whether to have Tubby Custard or Tubby Toast.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies leave their favourite things to watch some boys spinning some spinning tops to celebrate the Hanukah festival. Tinky Winky wears the skirt on his head to do a very special round and round dance.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies are asleep, but Noo-Noo tidies up their blankets. They stop chasing him to watch some children learn about the number five. A flashing light appears in Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies and some children learn about the colour blue. In Teletubbyland Po is watching the blue sky when it begins to rain.

programme.title: Yankees Classics
programme.desc: From 1976: Kansas City at New York in Game 5 of the ALCS. Chris Chambliss belted a game-winning homer in the ninth to send the Yankees to the World Series for the first time since 1964.

programme.desc: Highlighting Chris Chambliss's walk-off home run to beat the Royals in Game 5 of the 1976 ALCS.

programme.title: Yankeeography

programme.title: The Big Match Revisited
programme.desc: Brian Moore introduces football highlights from January 1976 including a pulsating match at White Hart Lane between Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United, Ipswich Town against Coventry City, and Burnley against Derby County.

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: Meet the company flying the flag for British manufacturing with their hand-sewn Union Jacks which have been seen flying over Buckingham Palace. Things heat up in a Devon forge that produces wood burning stoves that are exported around the world. Learn about the labour of love that goes into creating beautiful handmade marbles, and discover the secret recipe of a British kitchen cupboard staple dating back almost 200 years.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Todd White faces a ban after being caught speeding, an overturned diesel tanker threatens an environmental disaster, and TJ Tilcox gets his hands on a brand-new vehicle.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Sharpe sets out on a mission to exchange British deserters for guns, but he is soon caught up in the search for a missing cartographer following the arrival of the man's family, cousins of Wellington.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Sharpe and his men are attached to train the Spanish king's personal bodyguard, the Royal Irish Company, but its loyalty is put in doubt while a ruthless French officer out for revenge tests its readiness for battle.

programme.title: Police Academy 3: Back in Training
programme.desc: Slapstick farce with the incompetent cops as they set about saving their beloved academy from closure. Cutbacks mean that only one of the two police training schools can stay open, so Commandant Lassard appeals to the motley crew of graduates to come and train new recruits. However, the rival academy intends to sabotage their plans by cutting their training time down to a minimum.

programme.desc: When a massive, unmanned locomotive roars out of control, the threat is more ominous than just a derailment. The only hope of bringing the train to a safe stop is in the hands of a veteran engineer and a young conductor, who must risk their lives to save those in the runaway's path.

programme.desc: The paramedics are called out to a woman who's losing a lot of blood, and a man who has a condition where his throat swells up and closes without warning. Another man falls and cuts his head so badly that the paramedics can see his skull.

programme.title: Ancient Autopsy

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Exploring the difference between white and dark rum, what the jelly is in a jelly bean, and why anchovies taste salty as Kate, Jimmy and Matt revisit some of their favourite investigations around the world.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: In the magnificent Lot Valley, Jon and Carmen play tug of war with the imposing vines threatening their tower. And Christina and Sassan call for help as they take on a poolside kitchenette.

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Tim and Sasha overhaul an outdated bedroom with some upcycling ingenuity. Christina and Sassan's poolside kitchenette pushes them to the limit. And Tim and Krys race to finish three new bedrooms before their first ever guests arrive.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at Chimneys B&B in Holbrook, Suffolk, where owner Carolyn Spilling, joined by friend Delia Duell, hopes her up-tempo personality will be a hit with the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz are off to Wolverhampton to take on a 1980 Jaguar XJ-S V12, a great British Grand Tourer that has sadly fallen into neglect.

programme.desc: The paramedics are called out to a woman who has had a seizure on a bus, a man who's too weak to reach his oxygen supply, a young woman with terminal cancer who has collapsed and a man who needs the paramedics' help just to breathe.

programme.desc: Prima ballerina Dominika Egorova faces a bleak and uncertain future after she suffers an injury that ends her career.
